title: Genre: Narrative
objective: Apply narrative-reading strategies to historical stories

segments.audio_script: This is lesson seven. Begin genre analysis with narrative reading strategies.
No passage required. Practice identifying plot, characters, setting, and outcome.
Narrative teaches through events and character actions. Pay attention to authorial selection and sequence.
Ask about narrative point of view, focalization, and thematic refrains. Note what is included and omitted.
Key theme: narratives shape theology through story not propositional statement.
Name a structural feature to observe in narrative texts.
This completes lesson seven. Next lesson examines poetic texts and parallelism.

vocabulary.definition: The narrative perspective through which events are perceived
